abstract: Politicians and students in Hong Kong share thoughts on growing fissures in China's democracy movement ahead of anniversary of Chinese military's suppression of 1989 democracy protests in Beijing; Hong Kong's largest student union has for first time in 26 years declined to join Chinese activists in vigil as Hong Kong residents increasingly focus on their own independence.
lead_paragraph: For years, activists, student leaders and politicians gathered to declare solidarity in a continuing struggle for political change in China. This year is different.

headline.main: Remembering Tiananmen in Hong Kong, but Not Without Divisions

snippet: For years, activists, student leaders and politicians gathered to declare solidarity in a continuing struggle for political change in China. This year is different.

keywords.value: Hong Kong Alliance in Support of Patriotic Democratic Movements of China
keywords.name: organizations
